**you will learn the basics of Markdown, a lightweight markup language that is widely used for formatting plain text**

*a lightweight markup language that is widely used for formatting plain text.*

*It is used to create websites, documents, notes, presentations and technical documentation.*

### [Emphasizing text in Markdown](https://skepfoundation.github.io/pages_course/lessons/unit_01/lesson_03/lesson_03.html#emphasizing-text-in-markdown)

*In Markdown, the use of asterisks (\*) or underscores (\_) allows you to emphasize text by making it either italic or bold.*

### [Headings in Markdown](https://skepfoundation.github.io/pages_course/lessons/unit_01/lesson_03/lesson_03.html#headings-in-markdown)

*Headings are created using hash (#) symbols.*

### [Lists in Markdown](https://skepfoundation.github.io/pages_course/lessons/unit_01/lesson_03/lesson_03.html#lists-in-markdown)

*You can create both unordered lists (bullet points) and ordered lists (numbered items)*

# Unit 2 - Git and VSCode

**This unit will introduce students to git and VSCode. Git will be taught as a command line tool rather than VSCode’s “Source Control” option. Basic git commands will be taught like add, commit, push, and pull. Students will be set up to continue to edit their github profile readme in VSCode after setting up the repo locally.**
